lines.text: The trouble with me is I can never say what I really feel, what I really think. You do. It's one of the things I like about you.
I try not to be. I do try.
My mother always said I'd marry two men.
Yes, but at the same time.
At the same time? She said that?
No, it's my own idea. It's a secret desire, I confess it. I wouldn't live with both.
No, I'd divide my time. I'd have one one week and the other the next.
Very nice. I'm just thinking what my mother would say.
She would find it... somewhat irregular.
If I don't go now, I never will... I mean it!
